ActionButtonDescription: You can disable the Action and + buttons in the current section header to limit creation of files, folders, and rooms.
CSPDescription: Enter the address of the service where you'd like to embed or connect your {{organizationName}} {{productName}}.
CSPHeader: Add the allowed domains for this {{productName}}
CSPHelp: This setting is a security mechanism that can be used to protect against content injection attacks. The CSP describes secure resource download sources. Downloading from resources not included in the `white list` is blocked. Specify the domains (together with the protocol) with which it will work.
CSPInfoBarDescription: Please enable the HTTPS protocol for your {{productName}} to ensure the correct setup work.
CSPUrlHelp: Please provide only the domain name, avoiding URL paths or extra characters.
CustomDescription: Manually configure the parameters for embedding your {{productName}}.
DisplayColumns: Displaying columns in a file row
EditorDescription: Embed an editor to allow users to edit a file from the corresponding room.
ElementCalledAfterClicking: The element will be called after clicking
EmbedCodeSuccessfullyCopied: Embed code successfully copied to clipboard
FileSelectorDescription: Embed a file selector to allow users to access any file from the list of the available ones.
FilesSearchDescription: File search within the opened folder/room.
HeaderDescription: You can disable header in the mobile version to limit access to the {{productName}} sections (just like disabling the left menu in the desktop version).
HtmlCodeDescription: Embedding {{productName}} or its part using the <script> tag. Copy the HTML code below and insert it into your HTML file.
InitializeSDK: Select one of the suggested modes, or use Custom to configure all the parameters manually.
ItemsCountDescription: You can specify the number of files / folders displayed on one page, as well as specify which page to start displaying
JavaScriptCodeDescription: Embedding {{productName}} or its part using JavaScript. Copy the JavaScript code below.
LinkSetDescription: This link is protected with a {{parameter}}. To configure the link,
LinkSetDescription2: A {{parameter1}} and {{parameter2}} is set for this link. To configure it,
LinkSetDescription3: A {{parameter1}}, {{parameter2}}, and {{parameter3}} is set for this link. To configure it,
ManagerSearchBlockDescription: You can disable the search, filter and sort options.
ManagerTitleDescription: You can disable the title of the current section/room/folder.
MenuDescription: You can disable the left menu if users don't need to navigate to other sections.
NPMCodeConfigStep: Create config object with required parameters:
NPMCodeCreateStep: Create HTML element with id from config and insert it inside document body for place SDK frame:
NPMCodeImportStep: Import the package in your project:
NPMCodeInstallStep: Install package from npm and save it to the package.json file with --save:
NPMCodeUsageStep: Use SDK init method to create SDK frame:
PortalDescription: Embed the whole {{productName}} to allow users to interact with all rooms, files, and settings.
PublicRoomPresetInfo: Embed a public room to allow users to view, edit, comment, or review all the documents stored there without registration
RoomOrFolderDescription: You can select the section, room or folder you want to display
RoomSelectorDescription: Embed a room selector to allow users to access any room from the list of the available ones.
SDKDescription: JavaScript SDK allows you to embed the whole {{productName}} or its part into your web interface. Select ready-to-use modes with the pre-defined parameters or a custom one to configure it manually. To learn more about SDK, refer to the
SdkPackageVersionInfo: For connect as package version always latest
SelectModeEmbedding: Select a mode for embedding your {{productName}}
SettingUpColumnsDescription: You can disable the ability for users to manage and customize file information columns in list view.
Subtitle: Subtitle
SubtitleDescription: Subtitle with additional comments or descriptions for the current directory.
ViewerDescription: Embed a viewer to allow users to open a file for viewing from the corresponding room.
